title: The Howey Test
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Howey Test.

hook.text: The Howey Test is a 1946 Supreme Court ruling that determines what counts as a security. The SEC uses it against crypto.

buildup.text: The test asks: did someone invest money in a common enterprise expecting profits from the efforts of others?

discovery.text: Most crypto tokens pass the Howey Test. Investors buy tokens expecting the team to build something that increases value.

twist.text: Bitcoin likely fails the test â€” there's no central team whose efforts drive profits. Ethereum's classification is still debated.

climax.text: A 1946 orange grove case now determines the fate of a trillion-dollar digital industry. Law evolves slowly.

punchline.text: An orange grove ruling from 1946 decides which cryptocurrencies are legal.

quiz.question: What does the Howey Test determine?
options: Whether an asset qualifies as a security under US law
